content.text:
# John Sydenham (14th-century MP)

John Sydenham, of Somerset, was MP for the Bridgwater constituency of the parliament of England six times between 1377 and 1397.  He was recorded as a tax collector in Somerset in 1382, 1392 and 1401.  During the Peasants' Revolt of 1381 his manor house at Sydenham, near Bridgwater was ransacked and goods to the value of Â£100 stolen.  His daughter Ida married Robert Boson, who was MP for Bridgwater in the 1393 parliament.
